thread.title: Mets fan a victim of bloody Dodger Stadium beatdown
thread.title_full: Mets fan a victim of bloody Dodger Stadium beatdown | New York Post

author: David K. Li
title: Mets fan a victim of bloody Dodger Stadium beatdown
text:
A Mets fan was in critical condition after a brutal attack by Los Angeles hooligans over the weekend outside Dodger Stadium, police said.
The bloody beatdown unfolded around 10:30 p.m. local time Friday in the stadium parking lot, following the Mets’ 3-1 victory in Game 1 of the National League Division Series.
Witnesses said the Mets fan was punched and then fell, hitting his head.
“I walked closer and there was a gentleman on the floor and [he] was bleeding profusely from the head,” witness Maria Cerecer told KABC-TV. 
“We got free rally towels that night, so they [good Samaritans] were holding the rally towels to his head.”
The unidentified Mets fan was listed in critical but stable condition at Los Angeles County + USC Medical Center.
There were no immediate arrests, and cops were asking for the public’s help to catch the thugs.
Violent fan behavior has been a problem at Dodger Stadium for years. The Friday night assault is drawing comparisons with the horrific beating of a San Francisco Giants fan in 2011.
Bryan Stow suffered permanent brain damage from his beating at the hands of Dodgers fans Marvin Norwood and Louie Sanchez , who are both serving long prison sentences for the attack. Stow, a Northern California paramedic, sued Dodgers ownership and a civil jury awarded him $18 million in 2014.
